message: Would love to have your guys' thoughts! http://gumroad.com/
I think its a great idea.  The site looks like it is simple and easy to use.  I might try and sell some old photographs, logo / template designs using it.
the concept isn't that clear and also what about copyrights i feel i can post any link and sell it and be long gone before someone realized they been had just something you need to look into
I think there should be an option for users to upload their digital product (pdf, zip, psd file, etc.). I don't think using link is quite reliable
love the simplicity, what are you using for payment processing? paypal?
why not just let people upload the stuff they want to sell?
I like it, nice design, simple concept.  Just needs a landing page with preview and then it's practically perfect.
Using Stripe.com for payment processing.
Working on making the home page better, but product first :)
Adding file uploading tonight hopefully.
The idea is really good. Of course the upload is necessary. But, the next phase should be to focus on some niche. Icon, app, background, webdesign, recipe...
@krymski excuse me?
nice, girl !
how was the effect of your HN post, you had many signups
what conversion ratio are you finding from visitor > register > use app
how do you find stripe.com? are they open for business already?
You can now upload files, and people can now pay using their card *or* PayPal!
Got around 50,000 pageviews in the first day. The effects of HN and the inherent viral aspect of the service.
Added a video to the site too!
I'm friends with the founder, so I get to use Stripe early.
